snippet: As Texas works to increase the number of residents with health coverage, some doctors have opted to avoid the insurance system’s bureaucracy, saying they can keep costs down with a cash-based model.

byline.contributor: This story was produced in partnership with  Kaiser Health News, an editorially independent program of the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation, a nonprofit, nonpartisan health policy research and communication organization not affiliated with Kaiser Permanente.

lead_paragraph: As Texas works to increase the number of residents with health coverage, some doctors have opted to avoid the insurance system’s bureaucracy, saying they can keep costs down with a cash-based model.

headline.main: Doctors Shun Insurance, Offering Care for Cash
headline.print_headline: Doctors Shun Insurance, Offering Care for Cash

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
